definition: to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
to wash/to bathe/to develop (photo)
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
respectful
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: Tell me your story, I‘m all ears.
sentences.chinese: 告诉我你的故事，我洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: Tell me a little more. I'm listening.
sentences.chinese: 请多说点儿，我洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: She takes all ears to what her mother have said.
sentences.chinese: 是美国常用的俚语，表示“洗耳恭听”之意。

sentences.english: As you wish to tell me, My dear, I doudt I have any choise in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 既然你那么想告诉我，亲爱的，我只有洗耳恭听了。

sentences.english: Okay. What do you want to tell me?
sentences.chinese: 好，你想告诉我什么？洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: We can talk now, I'm all ears.
sentences.chinese: 可以开始谈了，我以洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: If you have any other advice for me I'm all ears.
sentences.chinese: 如果你还有其他任何的建议，我都愿意洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: I was all ears and soaked every word in like a sponge.
sentences.chinese: 我洗耳恭听，像海棉一样吸收了每一个字。

sentences.english: Tell me your news; Im all ears.
sentences.chinese: 把你的新鲜事儿告诉我，我洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: The cop gave Tommy an impatient look but kept listening.
sentences.chinese: 警察不耐烦地看了汤米一眼，但还是洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: Valuable information can be yours if you listen to those with experience.
sentences.chinese: 洗耳恭听有经验者的建议，你会得到宝贵的信息。

sentences.english: Tell me about your trip, I am all ears.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有不同意见，我将洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: One must learn to be a good listener to stay in a genuine friendship.
sentences.chinese: 要想保持真正的友谊，必须学会洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: Really? Tell me about it. I'm all ears.
sentences.chinese: 真的？说说看。我洗耳恭听。

sentences.english: Jaco: Really? Tell me about it. I’m all ears.
sentences.chinese: 真的？说说看。我洗耳恭听。

definition: I'd like to hear the details
there is no harm in saying what one thinks (idiom)
enlightening remarks (honorific)/brilliant views
to receive instruction/to benefit from advice
to sit upright and still (idiom)
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
calm/unperturbed/(Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [lāu-sîn-tsāi-tsāi])
keep calm, don't get excited/don't be impatient
to nod and smile
not hiding anything he knows, not stopping before he has said it through (idiom)/frank/outspoken
pinyin: zhi1 wu2 bu4 yan2 , yan2 wu2 bu4 jin4

definition: overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)
pinyin: gong1 jing4 bu4 ru2 cong2 ming4

definition: in deadly earnest/deadpan
see 胸有成竹[xiong1 you3 cheng2 zhu2]
amiable manner/pleasant countenance
